meanings.definition: Uninitiates: those who have not been introduced to or instructed in a particular subject or activity.
meanings.sent1: The uninitiates in the group were eager to learn about the new game.
meanings.sent2: The uninitiates gathered around, curious to understand the concept.
meanings.sent3: The uninitiates looked puzzled when the advanced topic was discussed.
meanings.sent4: To the uninitiates, the complex machinery seemed like magic.
meanings.sent5: The uninitiates felt lost in the sea of unfamiliar terms.

meanings.definition: Uninitiates: to introduce someone to a particular subject or activity.
meanings.sent1: She uninitiates her friend to the joys of gardening.
meanings.sent2: He uninitiates newcomers to the rules of the game.
meanings.sent3: The teacher uninitiates the students to the wonders of science.
meanings.sent4: The guide uninitiates tourists to the beauty of the ancient ruins.
meanings.sent5: The mentor uninitiates the apprentice to the art of woodworking.
